cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it discusses the vulnerability of neural networks to adversarial attacks and the robust training methods used to mitigate this vulnerability. It also investigates the behavior of clean accuracy and robust accuracy of the Bayes classifier, which is a fundamental concept in machine learning. Additionally, the paper uses empirical investigations to confirm its findings, which is a common approach in machine learning research. 

The paper also involves computer vision (cs.CV) as it uses the MNIST and CIFAR10 datasets, which are commonly used in computer vision tasks. 

The paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it discusses the behavior of neural networks and their vulnerability to adversarial attacks, which is a topic of interest in the field of AI. 

The sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is also a possibility as the paper discusses the vulnerability of neural networks to adversarial attacks, which is a security concern. 

Lastly, the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is a possibility as the paper discusses the behavior of neural networks and their vulnerability to adversarial attacks, which is a topic of interest in the field of neural computing.
